text: Cortisol also called the stress hormone, is produced in the adrenal gland. It is a cortiocosteroid, often known as a steroid hormone. The purpose of cortisol is to help the body: * metabolize glucose * control blood pressure * suppress immunity * an inflammatory response Corticosteroids can also be used to replace certain hormones to treat illnesses. Addison’s disease is one. == Actions == ===Corticosteroids=== A Synthetic hormone normally produced by the adrenal glands. They’re used to treat conditions like: *asthma *allergic rhinitis and hayfever *atopic eczema *urticaria (hives) *chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) *painful and inflamed joints, muscles and tendons *lupus *inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) – including Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis *giant cell arteritis and polymyalgia rheumatica *multiple sclerosis (MS) == Related pages == * aldosterone and corticosteroid * pancreas ==References== ==Other websites== * Cortisol Category:Steroid hormones
